samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: The R programming language was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. The first official release came in 1995. R was developed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was created by John Chambers at Bell Laboratories. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the first names of the two creators (Ross and Robert).

The R programming language was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. The first official release came in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the first names of the two creators (Ross and Robert).

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
